abstract: The investor’s Berkshire Hathaway shows how intangible values like thrift and autonomy can translate into economic gain.
snippet: The investor’s Berkshire Hathaway shows how intangible values like thrift and autonomy can translate into economic gain.
lead_paragraph: Lawrence A. Cunningham, a professor at George Washington University and former corporate lawyer at Cravath, Swaine & Moore, has written numerous books including, most recently, “Berkshire Beyond Buffett: The Enduring Value of Values.”

headline.main: The Philosophy of Warren E. Buffett
